original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa sbyin zhing yongs su gtong ba'i tshe de rtag tu sbyin pa la sgyu pa'i blo nye bar gnas shing sbyin pa des sems can gang la yang phan pa'am mi phan par 'gyur ba mi mthong
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa sbyin zhing yongs su gtong ba'i tshe de rtag tu sbyin pa la sgyu pa'i blo nye bar gnas shing sbyin pa des sems can gang la yang phan pa'am mi phan par 'gyur ba mi mthong
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Su­bhūti, when great bodhisattva beings give gifts and are generous, their minds are always focused on the illusion-like nature of generosity, and they do not perceive that any sentient being is benefited or harmed by that generosity.

original: ste / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su yongs su mi bsngo'i /

analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /

translated: He dedicates in such a way that the three ideas do not occur: that of a dedication, that of an act of dedication, and that of a possessor of the dedication.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //

translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being, skilled in means, standing in the perfection of giving, incorporates the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi lhung ste /
translated: Through that perfection of wisdom and skill in means, he does not fall to the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level.

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas su yongs su mi bsngo'i /

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: In this way, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, standing in the perfection of patience, incorporates the perfection of giving.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /

analyzed: log par mi lta'o //

analyzed: bar mi sems to ;
translated: He does not think like that.

original: gzhan du na de 'di snyam du gang gi phyir bdag gi lus yongs su bsgrubs pa de dag 'dir 'ong zhing yan lag dang nyid lag bcad gtubs nas khyer zhing dor ba ni bdag gis thob par bya ba legs par thob bo snyam mo //
analyzed: gzhan du na de 'di snyam du gang gi phyir bdag gi lus yongs su bsgrubs pa de dag 'dir 'ong zhing yan lag dang nyid lag bcad gtubs nas khyer zhing dor ba ni bdag gis thob par bya ba legs par thob bo snyam mo //
translated: Otherwise, he thinks, “It is a good thing that they have come here to take away and discard my limbs and appendages, for which I have gone through the trouble of acquiring this body.”

original: de ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin yang legs par yid la byas pa yin te ;
analyzed: de ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin yang legs par yid la byas pa yin te ;
translated: He also keeps in mind the nature of things:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su mi bsngo'i /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su mi bsngo'i /
translated: He does not dedicate those wholesome roots to the disciples’ awakening or to the solitary sages’ awakening.

original: gzhan du na sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: Instead, he makes them common to all beings and dedicates them to unexcelled, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ji ltar gang gis yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang du yongs su bsngo ba'i 'du shes gsum mi 'jug pa de ltar yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar gang gis yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang du yongs su bsngo ba'i 'du shes gsum mi 'jug pa de ltar yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: He dedicates them in such a way that the three ideas—of dedication, of a thing dedicated, and of a recipient of the dedication—do not occur to him.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being standing in the perfection of perseverance incorporates the perfection of patience.

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dod pas dben pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dod pas dben pa /
translated: The Lord: Here, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being, quite secluded from the desires,

original: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa /
analyzed: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa /
translated: secluded from evil and unwholesome dharmas,

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: with thought adjusted and mind inclined to repulsiveness,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: dwells having attained the first concentration, which is with thought adjusted and with joy and happiness born of seclusion;

original: de rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang ste /
analyzed: de rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang ste /
translated: Having pacified discursive thought and analysis, he becomes inwardly clear,

original: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: and with a one-pointed mind, he achieves and remains in the second concentration, which is free from discursive thought and analysis and is filled with the joy and bliss of single-pointed concentration.

original: de dag dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral bas dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin du btang snyoms su gnas @114b te ;
analyzed: de dag dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral bas dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin du btang snyoms su gnas @114b te ;
translated: “ Free from attachment to joy, he remains mindful and discerning, and he achieves and remains in the third concentration, which is without joy.

original: bde ba lus kyis myong ba 'phags pa rnams kyis de la dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la rnam par dpyod pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /🔽dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: bde ba lus kyis myong ba 'phags pa rnams kyis de la dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la rnam par dpyod pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste / dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: The noble ones describe this as ‘mindful, happy abidance, free from joy.’

original: de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang mi bde ba snga ma nas kyang nub pas bde ba yang med /
analyzed: de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang mi bde ba snga ma nas kyang nub pas bde ba yang med /
translated: “ He gives up happiness and suffering, and with the disappearance of mental pleasure and displeasure, he achieves and remains in the fourth concentration, which is beyond pleasure and suffering.🔽“

original: sdug bsngal ba yang med pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang med pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He attains and abides in the fourth meditation, which is free from pleasure and pain, and is purified in terms of equanimity and mindfulness.

original: de sems can rnams la bde ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas byams pa tshad med pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de sems can rnams la bde ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas byams pa tshad med pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He attains and abides in immeasurable love, bringing to mind the idea of happiness for all sentient beings.

original: de sems can rnams la sdug bsngal ba dang bral ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas snying rje tshad med pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de sems can rnams la sdug bsngal ba dang bral ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas snying rje tshad med pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He attains and abides in immeasurable compassion, bringing to mind the idea of freedom from suffering for all sentient beings.

original: de sems can rnams la dga' ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas dga' ba tshad med pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de sems can rnams la dga' ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pas dga' ba tshad med pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He attains and abides in immeasurable joy, bringing to mind the idea of delight for all sentient beings.

original: de sems can rnams la sdug bsngal ba dang bde ba med pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pas btang snyoms tshad med pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de sems can rnams la sdug bsngal ba dang bde ba med pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pas btang snyoms tshad med pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He attains and abides in immeasurable equanimity, bringing to mind the idea of freedom from suffering and happiness for all sentient beings.

original: de gzugs la rags par 'du shes shing nam mkha' la zhi bar 'du shes pa yid la byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //🔽de nam mkha' la rags par 'du shes shing rnam par shes pa la zhi bar 'du shes pa yid la byed pas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //🔽de rnam par shes pa la rags par 'du shes shing cung zad med pa la zhi bar 'du shes pa yid la byed pas cung zad med pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de gzugs la rags par 'du shes shing nam mkha' la zhi bar 'du shes pa yid la byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so // de nam mkha' la rags par 'du shes shing rnam par shes pa la zhi bar 'du shes pa yid la byed pas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so // de rnam par shes pa la rags par 'du shes shing cung zad med pa la zhi bar 'du shes pa yid la byed pas cung zad med pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He establishes and abides in the station of endless space, having taken to mind the perception of space as peaceful.

original: de cung zad med pa la rags lus par 'du shes shing 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la zhi bar 'du shes pa yid la byed pas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so ;
analyzed: de cung zad med pa la rags lus par 'du shes shing 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la zhi bar 'du shes pa yid la byed pas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so ;
translated: He establishes and abides in the station of endless consciousness, having taken to mind the perception of consciousness as peaceful.🔽He establishes and abides in the station of nothing-at-all, having taken to mind the perception of nothing-at-all as peaceful.🔽He establishes and abides in the station of neither perception nor non-perception, having taken to mind the perception of neither perception nor non-perception as peaceful.

original: / de bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gi rnam par smin pa yongs su mi len te /🔽gzhan du na sems can rnams kyi don bya ba'i phyir de dag tu skye zhing sems can de dag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu @115a * //
analyzed: / de bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gi rnam par smin pa yongs su mi len te / gzhan du na sems can rnams kyi don bya ba'i phyir de dag tu skye zhing sems can de dag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu @115a * //
translated: He does not appropriate the evolutionary development of those meditative concentrations, immeasurables, and formless absorptions.

original: phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag la yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag la yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: Rather, he is born in those places in order to work for the welfare of sentient beings, and he brings those sentient beings to maturity in the six perfections: the perfection of generosity, the perfection of morality, the perfection of tolerance, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of meditation, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i don du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i don du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ste /
translated: He serves the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, in order to plant wholesome roots, and he goes from Buddha-field to Buddha-field.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'i /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'i /
translated: And he dedicates those wholesome roots to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, making them common to all sentient beings.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su yongs su mi bsngo ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su yongs su mi bsngo ste /
translated: He does not dedicate them to the śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha levels.

original: de ji ltar gang gis yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang du yongs su sngo bar byed ces pa'i 'du shes gsum mi 'jug pa de ltar yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar gang gis yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang du yongs su sngo bar byed ces pa'i 'du shes gsum mi 'jug pa de ltar yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: He dedicates them in such a way that the three ideas—the idea of an agent, the idea of a dedication, and the idea of a recipient—do not occur.🔽Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of perseverance incorporate the perfection of concentration.”

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of perseverance incorporate the perfection of wisdom.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: He asked, “Lord, how do bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of perseverance incorporate the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po dang rdzas dang / mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po dang rdzas dang / mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of perseverance do not see the perfection of giving as a thing, a substance, or a sign;

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: they do not see the perfection of morality, perfection of patience, perfection of perseverance, perfection of concentration, or perfection of wisdom as a thing, a substance, or a sign.

original: nang stong pa nyid dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽phyi nang stong pa nyid dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // phyi nang stong pa nyid dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see inner emptiness as a thing, as substance, or as a sign.🔽They do not see outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, emptiness of the unlimited, emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, emptiness of non-dispersal, emptiness of inherent existence, emptiness of all things, emptiness of intrinsic characteristics, or the emptiness of non-apprehension as a thing, as substance, or as a sign.🔽They do not see the emptiness of non-apprehension as a thing, as substance, or as a sign.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see the emptiness of essential nature as a thing, as substance, or as a sign.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams @115b dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams @115b dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the applications of mindfulness as a thing, as substance, or as a sign.

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, branches of awakening, or the eightfold noble path as a thing, as substance, or as a sign.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not consider the four noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, and the formless absorptions to be things, substances, or signs.🔽They do not consider the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, and the extrasensory powers to be things, substances, or signs.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not consider the dhāraṇī gateways to be things, substances, or signs.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dngos po rdzas dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dngos po rdzas dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not consider the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha to be things, substances, or signs.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not consider , up to and including omniscience, to be things, substances, or signs.

original: chos thams cad dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas chos gang la yang gnas mi 'cha' zhing de ji skad du smra ba de ltar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po dang rdzas dang mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas chos gang la yang gnas mi 'cha' zhing de ji skad du smra ba de ltar byed pa yin te /
translated: Since they do not consider any phenomena to be things, substances, or signs, they do not settle down on any phenomenon, and they do what they say they will do.

original: de dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su mi bsngo'i /
analyzed: de dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su mi bsngo'i /
translated: They do not dedicate those wholesome roots to the śrāvaka level or to the pratyekabuddha level.

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: and dedicates it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, making it common to all sentient beings.

original: de ji ltar gang gis yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang du yongs su bsngo bar byed ces bya ba'i 'du shes gsum mi 'jug pa de ltar yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar gang gis yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang du yongs su bsngo bar byed ces bya ba'i 'du shes gsum mi 'jug pa de ltar yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: He dedicates it in such a way that the three ideas—that of one who dedicates, that of a dedication, and that of something to which he is dedicating—do not occur to him.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems @116a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems @116a * //
translated: Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of perseverance incorporate the perfection of wisdom.”

original: dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him, “Lord, how do bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of concentration incorporate the perfection of giving?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of concentration do not apprehend form, do not apprehend the perfection of concentration, and do not apprehend a bodhisattva.

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dod pa dben /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dod pa dben /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva mahāsattvas, separated from desire,

original: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa /
analyzed: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa /
translated: separated from evil and nonvirtuous dharmas,

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: with applied thought and sustained thought,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: dwell having attained the first concentration that possesses both applied and sustained thought and is born of separation, joy, and bliss.

original: de rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang ste sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa la🔽nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang ste sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: Having pacified applied and sustained thought, internally clear and mind unified, they dwell having attained the second concentration that is born of single-pointed concentration, is without applied and sustained thought, and possesses joy and bliss.

original: de dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral bas dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin du btang snyoms su gnas te /
analyzed: de dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral bas dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin du btang snyoms su gnas te /
translated: Having become separated from joy, they dwell having attained the third concentration that is born of equanimity, mindfulness, alertness, and the wish to abandon, and possesses bliss.🔽Having abandoned bliss, they dwell having attained the fourth concentration that is born of neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant and pure mindfulness.

original: bde ba lus kyis myong ba 'phags pa rnams kyis de la dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la rnam par dpyod pas btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba lus kyis myong ba 'phags pa rnams kyis de la dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la rnam par dpyod pas btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: The noble ones describe the experience of pleasure by the body as equanimity that is mindful and investigates pleasure.

original: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //🔽de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas bde ba yang med /
analyzed: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so // de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas bde ba yang med /
translated: He accomplishes and dwells in the third concentration that is free of joy.🔽He abandons pleasure, abandons pain, and previously removed mental pleasure and displeasure.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang med pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang med pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa /
translated: Thus, he dwells neither paining nor pleasureing with pure equanimity and mindfulness.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He accomplishes and dwells in the fourth concentration.

original: de 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar la yang de bzhin du nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar la yang de bzhin du nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He accomplishes and dwells in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la gnas nas mi g-yeng ba'i yid kyis sems can de dag la zang zing gi sbyin pa dang chos kyi sbyin pa de yongs su gtong zhing gzhan zang zing gi sbyin pa dang chos kyi sbyin pa la yang🔽dag par bskul lo //
analyzed: de bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la gnas nas mi g-yeng ba'i yid kyis sems can de dag la zang zing gi sbyin pa dang chos kyi sbyin pa de yongs su gtong zhing gzhan zang zing gi sbyin pa dang chos kyi sbyin pa la yang dag par bskul lo //
translated: They also encourage others to give the gift of material things and the gift of Dharma.

original: zang zing gi sbyin pa dang chos kyi sbyin pa'i legs pa brjod do //
analyzed: zang zing gi sbyin pa dang chos kyi sbyin pa'i legs pa brjod do //
translated: They praise the gift of material things and the gift of Dharma.

original: gzhan yang zang zing gi sbyin pa dang chos kyi sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zang zing gi sbyin pa dang chos kyi sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed pa yin te /
translated: They also praise those who give the gift of material things and the gift of Dharma, rejoicing in them.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su mi bsngo'i /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su mi bsngo'i /
translated: They do not dedicate those wholesome roots to the level of the śrāvakas or to the level of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: gzhan du na sems can thams cad dang thun @116b mong du byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can thams cad dang thun @116b mong du byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: Instead, they share them with all sentient beings and dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ji ltar 'di la gang gis sngo bar byed pa'am gang sngo bar byed pa'am gang du sngo bar byed pa'i 'du shes rnam pa gsum mi 'jug pa de ltar yongs su sngo bar byed do
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ji ltar 'di la gang gis sngo bar byed pa'am gang sngo bar byed pa'am gang du sngo bar byed pa'i 'du shes rnam pa gsum mi 'jug pa de ltar yongs su sngo bar byed do
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being dedicates so that the three notions do not occur: that of someone who dedicates, that of something to be dedicated, and that of a recipient of the dedication.

original: // rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: // rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being standing in the perfection of concentration incorporates the perfection of generosity.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Lord, how do bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of concentration incorporate the perfection of morality?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Here, Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of concentration do not apprehend form, do not apprehend the production of form, do not apprehend the destruction of form, do not apprehend the grasping of form, and do not apprehend the letting go of form.

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sems 'dod chags dang ldan pa mi bskyed /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sems 'dod chags dang ldan pa mi bskyed /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings, standing in the perfection of concentration, do not produce a mind associated with attachment,

original: sems zhe sdang dang ldan pa dang / gti mug dang ldan pa dang / 'tshe ba dang ldan pa mi bskyed /
analyzed: sems zhe sdang dang ldan pa dang / gti mug dang ldan pa dang / 'tshe ba dang ldan pa mi bskyed /
translated: do not produce a mind associated with anger, do not produce a mind associated with confusion, and do not produce a mind associated with harm.

original: gzhan du na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas rnam par spyod cing /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: gzhan du na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas rnam par spyod cing / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: They practice with attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects.🔽They do not dedicate those wholesome roots to the śrāvaka level

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su mi bsngo'i /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su mi bsngo'i /
translated: or to the pratyekabuddha level.

original: gzhan du na sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing /
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing /
translated: Rather, they make them into something shared in common with all sentient beings

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: and dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ji ltar gang gis yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang du yongs su bsngo ba'i 'du shes gsum mi 'jug pa de ltar yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar gang gis yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang du yongs su bsngo ba'i 'du shes gsum mi 'jug pa de ltar yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: He dedicates in such a way that the three ideas do not occur: that of a dedication, that of an act of dedication, and that of a possessor of the dedication.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: In this way, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, standing in the perfection of meditation, seizes the perfection of morality.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Subhuti: How, O Lord, does the Bodhisattva, the great being, standing in the perfection of meditation, seize the perfection of patience?

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa @117a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa @117a * //
translated: The Lord: Here, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has stood in the perfection of meditation, does not review form, etc.

original: gnas shing gzugs la dbu ba lta bur rab tu rtog / tshor ba la chu bur lta bu dang / 'du shes la smig rgyu lta bu dang / 'du byed la chu shing lta bu dang / rnam par shes pa la sgyu ma lta bur rab tu rtog ste /
analyzed: gnas shing gzugs la dbu ba lta bur rab tu rtog / tshor ba la chu bur lta bu dang / 'du shes la smig rgyu lta bu dang / 'du byed la chu shing lta bu dang / rnam par shes pa la sgyu ma lta bur rab tu rtog ste /
translated: He thoroughly understands that form is like foam, that feeling is like bubbles, that perception is like a mirage, that volitional factors are like a plantain tree, and that consciousness is like an illusion.

original: de de ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la so sor rtog cing snying po med par 'du shes pa nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de de ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la so sor rtog cing snying po med par 'du shes pa nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Thus, he thoroughly investigates the five appropriated aggregates and the perception of their lack of essence is present.

original: de ltar so sor rtogs pas de 'di snyam ste /
analyzed: de ltar so sor rtogs pas de 'di snyam ste /
translated: When he thoroughly investigates in this way, he thinks as follows:

original: yan lag dang nyid lag bcad gtubs kyang su la spyod /
analyzed: yan lag dang nyid lag bcad gtubs kyang su la spyod /
translated: “Even if the major and minor body parts are cut and chopped, who is the one who experiences?

original: su la bcad /
analyzed: su la bcad /
translated: To whom is it cut?

original: lus la ni su'i las /🔽tshor ba ni su'i tshor ba /
analyzed: lus la ni su'i las / tshor ba ni su'i tshor ba /
translated: To whom does the body belong?🔽To whom does feeling belong?

original: 'du shes ni su'i 'du shes /
analyzed: 'du shes ni su'i 'du shes /
translated: To whom does perception belong?

original: 'du byed ni su'i 'du byed /
analyzed: 'du byed ni su'i 'du byed /
translated: To whom do volitional factors belong?

original: rnam par shes pa ni su'i rnam par shes pa snyam ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni su'i rnam par shes pa snyam ste /
translated: To whom does consciousness belong?”

original: de de ltar so sor rtog pa'i tshe 'di snyam ste /
analyzed: de de ltar so sor rtog pa'i tshe 'di snyam ste /
translated: When he thoroughly investigates in this way, he thinks as follows:

original: gang la spyod pa dang kyal pa byas na gnod sems su skye ba de lta bu'i spyod pa yang gang zhig yod /
analyzed: gang la spyod pa dang kyal pa byas na gnod sems su skye ba de lta bu'i spyod pa yang gang zhig yod /
translated: What kind of behavior or idle talk would give rise to malice?

original: 'khyal pa yang gang zhig yod snyam ste /
analyzed: 'khyal pa yang gang zhig yod snyam ste /
translated: What kind of idle talk would there be?

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su mi bsngo'i /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su mi bsngo'i /
translated: He does not dedicate those wholesome roots to the śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha levels,

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: but makes them into something shared in common by all sentient beings and dedicates them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ji ltar gang gis yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang du yongs su bsngo ba'i 'du shes gsum mi 'jug pa de ltar yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar gang gis yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang du yongs su bsngo ba'i 'du shes gsum mi 'jug pa de ltar yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: He dedicates them in such a way that the three notions do not operate: the notion of an agent, the notion of an object, and the notion of a dedication.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of concentration

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no /🔽// / bam po lnga bcu brgyad pa /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no /🔽// / bam po lnga bcu brgyad pa /
translated: take hold of the perfection of patience.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: He asked, “Blessed One, how do bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of concentration take up the perfection of perseverance?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing 'dod pas dben /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing 'dod pas dben /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of concentration, separated from desire,

original: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa /🔽rtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa / rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: separated from evil and unwholesome dharmas,

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: with thought and reflection,🔽with the joy and happiness born of separation,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: establish and maintain the first concentration.

original: de rnam par rtog pa dang @117b rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang ste /
analyzed: de rnam par rtog pa dang @117b rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang ste /
translated: When their thought and reflection have been stilled,

original: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa /
translated: with an inner tranquility and a one-pointed mind, they are without thought and without reflection,

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He abides in the second concentration, which is free from the investigation and analysis that are the cause of distraction and is accompanied by the joy and pleasure born of concentration.🔽

original: de dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral bas dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin du btang snyoms la gnas te /
analyzed: de dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral bas dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin du btang snyoms la gnas te /
translated: He accomplishes and dwells in the second concentration, which is free of discursive thought and sustained thought, and is full of the joy and bliss born of samādhi.

original: bde ba lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la rnam par dpyod pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: bde ba lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la rnam par dpyod pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: Free of attachment to joy, he dwells mindfully and with clear awareness, experiencing bliss with his body, and enters the third concentration, which the noble ones describe as “free of joy.”

original: de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing /
analyzed: de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing /
translated: He gives up both pleasure and pain, and so

original: yid bde ba dang mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas /
analyzed: yid bde ba dang mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas /
translated: with the disappearance of mental pleasure and pain,

original: bde ba yang med sdug bsngal ba yang med pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs shing gnas te //
analyzed: bde ba yang med sdug bsngal ba yang med pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs shing gnas te //
translated: he enters and dwells in the fourth concentration, which is beyond pleasure and pain, and is purified in terms of equanimity and mindfulness.

original: de bsam gtan dang bsam gtan gyi yan lag de dag la yang mtshan mar mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: de bsam gtan dang bsam gtan gyi yan lag de dag la yang mtshan mar mi 'dzin te /
translated: He does not even apprehend those meditative concentrations and branches of meditative concentration as signs.

original: de de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems dang ldan pas rdzu 'phrul rnam pa du ma nyams su myong bar byed de /
analyzed: de de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems dang ldan pas rdzu 'phrul rnam pa du ma nyams su myong bar byed de /
translated: Endowed with that mind of meditative equipoise, he experiences many kinds of miraculous powers.

original: de sa chen po 'di yang rab tu g-yo bar byed do //🔽gcig tu gyur zhing mang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de sa chen po 'di yang rab tu g-yo bar byed do // gcig tu gyur zhing mang por 'gyur ro //
translated: He shakes this great earth.🔽He becomes one and then many.

original: mang por gyur zhing gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mang por gyur zhing gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes many and then one.

original: snang ba dang mi snang ba yang nyams su myong bar byed do //
analyzed: snang ba dang mi snang ba yang nyams su myong bar byed do //
translated: He becomes visible and then invisible.

original: rtsig pa las thal ba dang / ra ba las thal ba dang / ri las thal bar thogs pa med par 'gro ste /
analyzed: rtsig pa las thal ba dang / ra ba las thal ba dang / ri las thal bar thogs pa med par 'gro ste /
translated: He goes unhindered through walls, through enclosures, through mountains,

original: dper na nam mkha' la bya ba bzhin no //🔽nam mkha' la yang 'gro ste /🔽dper na 'dab chags bya ba bzhin no //🔽sa la yang gyen du 'byung ba dang 'og tu 'dzul bar byed de /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la bya ba bzhin no // nam mkha' la yang 'gro ste / dper na 'dab chags bya ba bzhin no // sa la yang gyen du 'byung ba dang 'og tu 'dzul bar byed de /
translated: as if through space.🔽He dives in and out of the earth as if in water.

original: dper na chu la bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na chu la bya ba bzhin no //
translated: He walks on water without sinking as if on land.🔽Seated cross-legged, he travels through space like a bird.

original: chu la yang 'bying ba med par 'gro ste /
analyzed: chu la yang 'bying ba med par 'gro ste /
translated: They can also walk on water without sinking.🔽

original: dper na sa la bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sa la bya ba bzhin no //
translated: He can also walk on water without sinking as if it were dry land.

original: du bar 'thul zhing me 'bar te /
analyzed: du bar 'thul zhing me 'bar te /
translated: He can emit smoke and flames and burn his body with fire,

original: dper na me'i phung po chen po bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na me'i phung po chen po bzhin no //
translated: just as if he were a great bonfire.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba 'di dag 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che la 'di ltar mthu che zhing dbang che ba de dag kyang lag pas byugs shing tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du lus kyis dbang sgyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba 'di dag 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che la 'di ltar mthu che zhing dbang che ba de dag kyang lag pas byugs shing tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du lus kyis dbang sgyur ro //
translated: He can touch and stroke with his hand even up to the Brahma world.

original: de lha'i rna ba rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pas lha dang mi'i sgra nye ba'am ring yang rung ste thos so //
analyzed: de lha'i rna ba rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pas lha dang mi'i sgra nye ba'am ring yang rung ste thos so //
translated: With his divine ear, which is pure and surpasses the human, he hears both kinds of sounds, divine and human, whether far or near.

original: @118a * // de sems can pha rol dang gang zag pha rol gyi sems la sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: @118a * // de sems can pha rol dang gang zag pha rol gyi sems la sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: He knows the minds of other beings and persons, having comprehended them with his own mind.

original: 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows a mind with passion as a mind with passion,

original: bla na med pa'i sems kyi bar la bla na med pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //🔽de ni sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran te sems gcig kyang rjes su dran pa nas /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i sems kyi bar la bla na med pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so // de ni sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran te sems gcig kyang rjes su dran pa nas /
translated: up to the unsurpassed mind, he knows it as it really is.

original: sems brgya'i bar du yang rjes su dran no //🔽bskal pa gcig rjes su dran pa nas bskal pa brgya'i bar du yang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: sems brgya'i bar du yang rjes su dran no // bskal pa gcig rjes su dran pa nas bskal pa brgya'i bar du yang rjes su dran no //
translated: He recollects his various past lives, recollecting one life up to recollecting a hundred thousand lives.🔽He recollects one eon up to recollecting a hundred thousand eons.

original: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma'i bar du yang rjes su dran te /🔽bdag ni de lta bu zhig na 'dug ste /🔽ming ni 'di zhes bya /🔽rus ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma'i bar du yang rjes su dran te / bdag ni de lta bu zhig na 'dug ste / ming ni 'di zhes bya / rus ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: He recollects many eons, many hundreds of eons, many thousands of eons, many hundreds of thousands of eons.

original: rigs ni 'di zhes bya /🔽kha zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
analyzed: rigs ni 'di zhes bya / kha zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
translated: ‘I was there, with such a name, such a family, such a clan, such food, such an experience of pleasure and pain, such a lifespan.🔽Having passed away from there, I was reborn elsewhere.

original: yun ni 'di srid cig tu 'dug 'dug / tshe'i mtha' ni 'di tsam zhig tu gyur te /
analyzed: yun ni 'di srid cig tu 'dug 'dug / tshe'i mtha' ni 'di tsam zhig tu gyur te /
translated: There too I had such a name, such a family, such a clan, such food, such an experience of pleasure and pain, such a lifespan.

original: de ltar bdag 'di nas shi 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ltar bdag 'di nas shi 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Having passed away from there, I was reborn here.’🔽Thus he recollects his various past lives with their characteristics and particulars.

original: de nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes so zhes bya ba'i bar du rnam pa dang bcas /
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes so zhes bya ba'i bar du rnam pa dang bcas /
translated: Then, having died and passed from there, I was born here.🔽In this way, he recollects in sequence,

original: gtan tshigs dang bcas /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang bcas /
translated: with reasons and signs,

original: dan rtags dang bcas par bdag dang gzhan gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran no //
analyzed: dan rtags dang bcas par bdag dang gzhan gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran no //
translated: his own and others’ abodes in many ways.

original: de ni lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba nas sems can rnams las ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba'i bar du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de ni lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba nas sems can rnams las ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba'i bar du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses that of humans, he knows how beings pass away and are reborn, how beings are inferior or excellent, and so on, in accordance with their karma.

original: de mngon par shes pa lnga po de dag la gnas nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / yongs su dri ba dang / yongs su zhu ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang /
analyzed: de mngon par shes pa lnga po de dag la gnas nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / yongs su dri ba dang / yongs su zhu ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang /
translated: Abiding in those five superknowledges, he serves the blessed buddhas, asks questions and makes requests, accumulates the roots of virtue, and ripens beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ste /
translated: He goes from buddhafield to buddhafield in order to purify the buddhafields.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su mi bsngo'i /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su mi bsngo'i /
translated: He does not dedicate those wholesome roots to the śrāvaka level or to the pratyekabuddha level,

original: gzhan du na sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: but rather, having made them into something shared in common by all beings, he dedicates them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ji ltar gang gis yongs su bsngo @118b ba dang / gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang du yongs su bsngo ba'i 'du shes rnam pa gsum mi 'jug pa de ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: de ji ltar gang gis yongs su bsngo @118b ba dang / gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang du yongs su bsngo ba'i 'du shes rnam pa gsum mi 'jug pa de ltar yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: He dedicates them in such a way that the three notions do not operate: the notion of an agent, the notion of an object, and the notion of a dedication.🔽In that way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of concentration incorporate the perfection of perseverance.”

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of perseverance incorporate the perfection of patience.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: He asked, “Lord, how do bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of concentration incorporate the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pas gzugs mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pas gzugs mi dmigs so //
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of wisdom do not apprehend form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi dmigs so //
translated: do not apprehend feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness,

original: mig mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mig mi dmigs so //
translated: do not apprehend the eyes,

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid mi dmigs so //
translated: do not apprehend the ears, nose, tongue, body, or thinking mind,

original: gzugs mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gzugs mi dmigs so //
translated: do not apprehend a form,

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos mi dmigs so //
translated: do not apprehend a sound, a smell, a taste, a feeling, or dharmas,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa mi dmigs so //
translated: do not apprehend the eye consciousness,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du mi dmigs so //
translated: up to do not apprehend the thinking-mind consciousness,

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa mi dmigs so //
translated: do not apprehend eye contact,

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du mi dmigs so //
translated: up to the mind-contact is not apprehended.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba mi dmigs so //
translated: The feeling that arises from the condition of eye-contact is not apprehended.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i bar du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i bar du mi dmigs so //
translated: up to the feeling that arises from the condition of mind-contact is not apprehended.

original: sa'i khams mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sa'i khams mi dmigs so //
translated: The earth element is not apprehended.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du mi dmigs so //
translated: up to the consciousness element is not apprehended.

original: ma rig pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: ma rig pa mi dmigs so //
translated: Ignorance is not apprehended.

original: rga shi'i bar du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rga shi'i bar du mi dmigs so //
translated: up to old age and death is not apprehended.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs so //
translated: The perfection of giving is not apprehended.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs so //
translated: The perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are not apprehended.

original: nang stong pa nyid mi dmigs so ;
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid mi dmigs so ;
translated: Inner emptiness is not apprehended.

original: / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs so //
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is not apprehended.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams mi dmigs so //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams mi dmigs so //
translated: the applications of mindfulness are non-apprehensible,

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / @119a * //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / @119a * //
translated: the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the seven limbs of enlightenment,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mi dmigs so //🔽'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mi dmigs so // 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
translated: and the noble eightfold path are non-apprehensible.🔽The noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang /
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are gateways to liberation, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are non-apprehensible.

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mi dmigs so //
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mi dmigs so //
translated: the great love, the great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are non-apprehensible,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs so //
translated: up to and the knowledge of all aspects is non-apprehensible.

original: 'dus byas kyi khams mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams mi dmigs so //
translated: The compounded element is non-apprehensible,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams mi dmigs so //
translated: and the uncompounded element is non-apprehensible.

original: de ltar mi dmigs pas na mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs pas na mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: Since they are non-apprehensible in that way, they are not brought about.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed pas na skye ba dang 'gag par mi byed do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed pas na skye ba dang 'gag par mi byed do //
translated: Since they are not brought about, they are not produced or stopped.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is because whether the tathāgatas arise or do not arise,

original: chos rnams kyi chos kyi gnas nyid de ni gnas pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos kyi gnas nyid de ni gnas pa ste /
translated: the true nature of dharmas remains,

original: chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid gnas pa'i phyir de mi skye mi 'gag pas de g-yeng ba med pa'i sems dang ldan par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang ma bral ba yin te dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid gnas pa'i phyir de mi skye mi 'gag pas de g-yeng ba med pa'i sems dang ldan par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang ma bral ba yin te dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang
translated: They do not dedicate those roots of virtue

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su yongs su mi bsngo'i /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su yongs su mi bsngo'i /
translated: to the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: Having made them common to all sentient beings, they dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ji ltar gang gis yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang du yongs su sngo ba'i 'du shes gsum mi 'jug pa de ltar yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar gang gis yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang du yongs su sngo ba'i 'du shes gsum mi 'jug pa de ltar yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: They dedicate them in such a way that the three notions—the one who dedicates, the dedication, and the one to whom it is dedicated—do not occur.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being standing in the perfection of concentration incorporates the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Lord: Here, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being, coursing in the perfection of wisdom, sees that all dharmas are empty.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin @119b pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin @119b pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhuti: How does the Bodhisattva, the great being, coursing in the perfection of wisdom, incorporate the perfection of giving?

original: chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //🔽gsol pa ; bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //🔽gsol pa ; bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: The Lord: Here, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, coursing in the perfection of wisdom, sees that all dharmas are empty.

original: chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bgyi bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ba lags /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bgyi bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ba lags /
translated: and sees all dharmas as empty.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Here, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: nang stong pa nyid la nang stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la nang stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: they do not apprehend ‘inner emptiness’ as ‘inner emptiness.’

original: phyi stong pa nyid la phyi stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid la phyi stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: They do not apprehend ‘outer emptiness’ as ‘outer emptiness.’

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid la phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid la phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: They do not apprehend ‘inner and outer emptiness’ as ‘inner and outer emptiness.’

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: They do not apprehend ‘emptiness of emptiness’ as ‘emptiness of emptiness.’

original: chen po stong pa nyid la chen po stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid la chen po stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: They do not apprehend ‘great emptiness’ as ‘great emptiness.’

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid la don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid la don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: They do not apprehend ‘ultimate emptiness’ as ‘ultimate emptiness.’

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid la 'dus byas stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid la 'dus byas stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: The emptiness of conditioned phenomena is not apprehended as the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: The emptiness of unconditioned phenomena is not apprehended as the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: The emptiness of what transcends limits is not apprehended as the emptiness of what transcends limits.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: The emptiness of what is beginningless and endless is not apprehended as the emptiness of what is beginningless and endless.

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: The emptiness of what is not to be discarded is not apprehended as the emptiness of what is not to be discarded.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: The emptiness of inherent existence is not apprehended as the emptiness of inherent existence.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena is not apprehended as the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: In the emptiness of defining attributes, the emptiness of defining attributes is not apprehended.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de stong pa nyid bcu bzhi po de dag la gnas shing gzugs stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de stong pa nyid bcu bzhi po de dag la gnas shing gzugs stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings standing in those fourteen kinds of emptiness do not apprehend form as empty or not empty.

original: tshor ba dang / @120a * //🔽'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / @120a * // 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: They do not apprehend feeling,🔽perception, volitional factors, or consciousness as empty or not empty.

original: skye mched dang khams dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba stong pa zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: skye mched dang khams dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba stong pa zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: They do not apprehend the emptiness of the constituents and the emptiness of the sense fields and dependent origination as empty or not empty.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: They do not apprehend the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the perfections, the emptinesses, and the doors of liberation as empty or not empty.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, and the nine serial absorptions as empty or not empty.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //🔽mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so // mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: He does not apprehend emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness as empty or not empty.
