original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: He does not apprehend the powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha as empty or not empty.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: up to and including unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, as empty or not empty.

original: 'dus byas kyi khams stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: The compounded element is not apprehended as empty or not empty.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar dmigs te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar dmigs te /
translated: The uncompounded element is not apprehended as empty or not empty.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod cing /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings practicing this perfection of wisdom

original: zas sam / skom mam /
analyzed: zas sam / skom mam /
translated: give gifts of food,🔽drink,🔽vehicles,

original: bzhon pa'am / gos sam /
analyzed: bzhon pa'am / gos sam /
translated: clothes,

original: me tog gam /🔽phreng ba'am / spos sam /
analyzed: me tog gam / phreng ba'am / spos sam /
translated: flowers,🔽garlands,🔽incense,🔽ointments,

original: byug pa'am / mal cha'am /🔽gnas sam / 'tsho ba'am /
analyzed: byug pa'am / mal cha'am / gnas sam / 'tsho ba'am /
translated: beds,🔽lodgings,

original: yo byad dam /
analyzed: yo byad dam /
translated: livelihoods,🔽or any human necessities whatsoever.

original: mi'i yo byad gang ci yang rung sbyin pa gang dang gang gtong yang des sbyin pa de gtang zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: mi'i yo byad gang ci yang rung sbyin pa gang dang gang gtong yang des sbyin pa de gtang zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: Whatever gifts they give, they do not see that gift as a gift.

original: gang yongs su gtong ba dang gang la yongs su gtong ba de dag gtong zhes bya bar rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: gang yongs su gtong ba dang gang la yongs su gtong ba de dag gtong zhes bya bar rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: He does not see that which is given away, that to which it is given away, or that by which it is given away.

original: de la 'jungs pa'i sems sam yongs su 'dzin pa'i sems kyi skabs med do //
analyzed: de la 'jungs pa'i sems sam yongs su 'dzin pa'i sems kyi skabs med do //
translated: There is no opportunity for a miserly mind or a grasping mind.

original: @120b de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @120b de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: For a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom, from the time of the first production of the thought of awakening onward,

original: snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du rnam par rtog pa de dag thams cad med de /
analyzed: snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du rnam par rtog pa de dag thams cad med de /
translated: all those conceptualizations are absent, up to and at the time of sitting at the seat of awakening.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa la ji ltar 'jungs pa'i thugs sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa la ji ltar 'jungs pa'i thugs sam /
translated: For a tathāgata, a worthy one, a perfectly awakened one, a superior, perfect buddha, how could there be a miserly mind or a grasping mind?

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i thugs mi mnga' ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yang 'jungs pa'i sems sam yongs su 'dzin pa'i sems skye ba med de /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i thugs mi mnga' ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yang 'jungs pa'i sems sam yongs su 'dzin pa'i sems skye ba med de /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they do not have a stingy mind or a grasping mind.

original: de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ston pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ston pa'o //
translated: It is because this perfection of wisdom is the teacher of bodhisattva great beings.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su yongs su mi bsngo'i /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su yongs su mi bsngo'i /
translated: They do not dedicate those wholesome roots to the śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha levels,

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: but having made them common to all beings, they dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ji ltar gang gis yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang du yongs su bsngo ba'i 'du shes gsum mi 'jug pa de ltar yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar gang gis yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang du yongs su bsngo ba'i 'du shes gsum mi 'jug pa de ltar yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: They dedicate them in such a way that the three notions do not operate: the notion of dedication, the notion of a dedicator, and the notion of a recipient of the dedication.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas la gnas shing nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas la gnas shing nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being standing in the perfection of wisdom incorporates the perfection of giving.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i go skabs mi 'byed do //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i go skabs mi 'byed do //
translated: The Lord: Here, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being standing in the perfection of wisdom does not open the way to the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar de nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar de nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: And why?

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa yang mi dmigs so //
translated: Because he does not apprehend that śrāvaka level or pratyekabuddha level.🔽And why?

original: sems de yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: sems de yang mi dmigs te /
translated: Because he does not apprehend that thought.

original: de sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: de sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: From the time of first generating

original: snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du bdag gis kyang srog gcod pa spangs pa yin /🔽gzhan @121a * //
analyzed: snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du bdag gis kyang srog gcod pa spangs pa yin / gzhan @121a * //
translated: bodhicitta until sitting on the seat of awakening, I myself will abandon🔽taking life.

original: yang srog gcod pa spong ba la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: yang srog gcod pa spong ba la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I will encourage others to abandon taking life.

original: srog gcod pa spong ba'i legs pa brjod pa yin /
analyzed: srog gcod pa spong ba'i legs pa brjod pa yin /
translated: I will praise the abandoning of taking life.

original: gzhan gang gis srog gcod pa spangs pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan gang gis srog gcod pa spangs pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed pa yin /
translated: I will rejoice in the abandoning of taking life by others.🔽I myself will abandon taking what is not given, sexual misconduct,🔽false speech, slander, harsh speech, idle speech, covetousness, ill will,

original: bdag gis kyang ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / zhe gcod pa'i tshig dang / tshig kyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba spangs pa yin /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / zhe gcod pa'i tshig dang / tshig kyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba spangs pa yin /
translated: and wrong views.

original: gzhan yang log par lta ba spong ba la yang dag par bskul ba yin ;
analyzed: gzhan yang log par lta ba spong ba la yang dag par bskul ba yin ;
translated: I will encourage others to abandon wrong views.

original: log par lta ba spong ba'i legs pa brjod pa yin /
analyzed: log par lta ba spong ba'i legs pa brjod pa yin /
translated: I will praise the abandoning of wrong views.

original: gzhan gang gis log par lta ba spangs pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan gang gis log par lta ba spangs pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed pa yin /
translated: They speak in praise of others who have given up wrong views and they rejoice in them.

original: tshul khrims des nyan thos sam rang sangs rgyas kyi chos gang la yang chags par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: tshul khrims des nyan thos sam rang sangs rgyas kyi chos gang la yang chags par mi 'gyur na /
translated: Through that morality they do not become attached to any śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha Dharma,

original: gzhan man chad lta ci smos te /
analyzed: gzhan man chad lta ci smos te /
translated: let alone to any other.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: They dedicate those wholesome roots to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, making them common to all sentient beings.

original: de ji ltar gang gis yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang du yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang du yongs su bsngo ba'i 'du shes gsum mi 'jug pa de ltar yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar gang gis yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang du yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang du yongs su bsngo ba'i 'du shes gsum mi 'jug pa de ltar yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: They dedicate them in such a way that the three notions—that of a dedicator, that of a dedication, and that of a recipient of the dedication—do not occur.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being standing in the perfection of wisdom incorporates the perfection of morality.

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa bskyed de /🔽de 'di snyam du 'di la chos gang yang skye ba'am 'gag pa'am 'byung ba'am /🔽'jig pa'am / 'chi ba'am /🔽gshe ba'am / spyo ba'am /🔽mtshang 'bru ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa bskyed de / de 'di snyam du 'di la chos gang yang skye ba'am 'gag pa'am 'byung ba'am / 'jig pa'am / 'chi ba'am / gshe ba'am / spyo ba'am / mtshang 'bru ba'am /
translated: The Lord: Here, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being standing in the perfection of wisdom produces the appropriate patience.🔽He thinks to himself: “Here no dharma is produced or stopped, does not come or go, is not diminished or increased, is not taken away or bestowed, is not defiled or purified, does not decrease or increase, is not bound or freed.

original: gcad pa'am / gtub pa'am /
analyzed: gcad pa'am / gtub pa'am /
translated: Here no dharma is seen that is born or dies, is shamed or humiliated, is cut or broken, is burned or split, is defiled or purified, is diminished or increased, is bound or freed.

original: brdeg pa med do snyam pas de la @121b sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du gal te sems can thams cad drung du lhags nas spyos te bskyel tam /🔽rdo dbyig gis brdegs sam /
analyzed: brdeg pa med do snyam pas de la @121b sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du gal te sems can thams cad drung du lhags nas spyos te bskyel tam / rdo dbyig gis brdegs sam /
translated: From the time of their first production of the thought of awakening until they sit on the seat of awakening, if all sentient beings were to come to them and revile and insult them,

original: mtshon gyis btab ste gcad cing gtubs kyang de la 'di snyam ste /
analyzed: mtshon gyis btab ste gcad cing gtubs kyang de la 'di snyam ste /
translated: or strike them with clods of earth, sticks, or swords,

original: kye ma chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di ni ngo mtshar che ste /
analyzed: kye ma chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di ni ngo mtshar che ste /

analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //

original: de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /

translated: Having distinguished the eight liberations and the nine successive abodes, he enters into and arises from the lion’s sport absorption.

translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization, he discriminates the twelve members of dependent origination in forward and reverse orders.

original: de la yan lag bcu gnyis gang dag ce na /
analyzed: de la yan lag bcu gnyis gang dag ce na /
translated: What are the twelve members?

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces so sor rtog go //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces so sor rtog go //
translated: Subhuti, here the bodhisattva-mahāsattva discriminates, “The condition of ignorance is volitional action.”

original: de bzhin du 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
translated: Similarly, the condition of volitional action is consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
translated: The condition of consciousness is name-and-form.🔽The condition of name-and-form is the six sense spheres.

analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug / skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
translated: The condition of the six sense spheres is contact.🔽The condition of contact is feeling.

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /🔽sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa / sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
translated: The condition of feeling is craving.🔽The condition of craving is grasping.

original: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /🔽srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa / srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi /
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi /
translated: The condition of birth is old age and death.

original: rga shi'i rkyen gyis mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang 'khrugs pa la so sor rtog par byed cing 'di ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes so sor rtog go //

translated: He discerns that if there were no old age and death, there would be no sorrow, lamentation, pain, despair, and distress.

original: de bzhin du skye ba med na rga shi 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba med na rga shi 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He discerns that if there were no birth, there would be no old age and death.

original: srid pa med na skye ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa med na skye ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He discerns that if there were no continuation, there would be no birth.

original: len pa med na srid pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: len pa med na srid pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He discerns that if there were no grasping, there would be no continuation.

original: sred pa med na len pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sred pa med na len pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He discerns that if there were no craving, there would be no grasping.

original: tshor ba med na srid pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur //
analyzed: tshor ba med na srid pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur //
translated: He discerns that if there were no feeling, there would be no craving.

original: reg pa med na tshor ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: reg pa med na tshor ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no contact, there is no occurrence of feeling.

original: skye mched drug med na reg pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye mched drug med na reg pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there are no six sense spheres, there is no occurrence of contact.

original: ming dang gzugs med na skye mched drug 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs med na skye mched drug 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no name-and-form, there is no occurrence of the six sense spheres.

original: rnam par shes pa med na ming dang gzugs 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med na ming dang gzugs 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no consciousness, there is no occurrence of name-and-form.

original: 'du byed med na rnam par shes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du byed med na rnam par shes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there are no volitional formations, there is no occurrence of consciousness.🔽If there is no ignorance, there are no occurrences of volitional formations.’

original: ma rig pa med na 'du byed 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes so sor rtog cing de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes so sor rtog go //

translated: In this way, the entire great mass of suffering ceases.”

analyzed: de ltar na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu @124a * //
translated: In this way, the ten links of dependent origination

translated: And he dedicates that wholesome root to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, having made it common to all sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gsungs pa yin no /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being standing in the perfection of wisdom takes hold of the perfection of concentration.

translated: then bodhisattva great beings who wish to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should master these six perfections in brief and in detail.

original: kun @126b chub par bgyis nas tshig gis shin tu goms par bgyi'o //
analyzed: kun @126b chub par bgyis nas tshig gis shin tu goms par bgyi'o //

analyzed: tshig gis shin tu goms par bgyis nas yid kyis rtogs par bgyi'o //

analyzed: de yang ci nas kyang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos mi rgyu ba de ltar rtogs par bgyi'o //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag mdo dang rgyas par bstan pa 'di dag la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag mdo dang rgyas par bstan pa 'di dag la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains in these six perfections, taught in brief and in detail, will know the brief and detailed Dharma.

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa 'tshal bar 'gyur ba lags /
translated: Śāriputra asked, “Blessed One, how will the bodhisattva mahāsattva know the brief and detailed Dharma?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid shes na chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: “If you know the suchness of form, you will know the brief and detailed Dharma.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang // rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid shes na chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang // rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid shes na chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you know the suchness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, you will know the brief and detailed Dharma.”

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid shes na chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi de bzhin nyid shes na chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid shes na chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro // pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi de bzhin nyid shes na chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one knows the suchness of the sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination, one will know the concise and extensive teachings of all phenomena.🔽If one knows the suchness of all perfections, all emptinesses, and the thirty-seven factors of awakening, one will know the concise and extensive teachings of all phenomena.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: If one knows the suchness of the noble truths, concentrations, immeasurables, formless absorptions, liberations, serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi de bzhin nyid shes na chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi de bzhin nyid shes na chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro ;
translated: If they know the suchness of the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, and the emptiness of essential nature, they will know the concise and extensive Dharma.🔽If they know the suchness of the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, they will know the concise and extensive Dharma.

original: / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi de bzhin nyid shes na chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid @127a * //
analyzed: / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi de bzhin nyid shes na chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid @127a * //
translated: If they know the suchness of the perfection of giving, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of skillful means, the perfection of aspiration, the perfection of strength, and the perfection of knowledge, they will know the concise and extensive Dharma.🔽If they know the suchness of the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, and the emptiness of essential nature, they will know the concise and extensive Dharma.🔽If they know the suchness of the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the three gateways to liberation, the eight aspects of liberation, and the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, they will know the concise and extensive Dharma.

original: shes na chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: shes na chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta bu lags /
translated: If they know the suchness of emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, they will know the concise and extensive Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽de bzhin nyid gang la skye ba mi dmigs /🔽'jig pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽de bzhin nyid gang la skye ba mi dmigs /🔽'jig pa mi dmigs /
translated: If they know the suchness of the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, they will know

original: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba mi dmigs pa 'di ni gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba mi dmigs pa 'di ni gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid de /
translated: This non-apprehension of form as other than its abiding in suchness is the suchness of form.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva should train in that.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ji lta bu lags /
translated: Śāriputra then asked, “Blessed One, what is the suchness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid ji lta bu lags /
translated: What is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects?”

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Śāriputra, the suchness of form is the suchness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.🔽The suchness of form is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The suchness of form is the suchness of the perfection of giving.🔽The suchness of form is the suchness of the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das yang dag pa'i mtha' gang lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das yang dag pa'i mtha' gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: mtha' med pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: The Lord : The non-limit is the Reality limit.

analyzed: mtha' 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Bodhisattva, the great being, who trains in this non-limit, he knows the brief and detailed meaning of all dharmas.

original: chos kyi dbyings shes na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shes na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: When he knows the dharma-element, the Bodhisattva, the great being, knows the brief and detailed meaning of all dharmas.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das chos kyi dbyings gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das chos kyi dbyings gang lags /
translated: Subhuti : What is the dharma-element?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de la chad pa dang po dang yongs su chad pa mi @127b dmigs so //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma lags pa'i chos de dag kyang gang lags /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: gang ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med @128a * //
translated: That which is essenceless is a non-entity.

original: pa'o ; / dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin te da ltar chos thams cad shes par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin te da ltar chos thams cad shes par bya'o //
translated: A non-entity is neither conjoined nor disjoined, and so too all dharmas should be seen.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mdor bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mdor bsdus pa ste /
translated: This, Subhūti, is the summary of the perfection of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: mdor bsdus pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya'o //
translated: In this summary perfection, the beginner bodhisattva great beings should train.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa la gnas te mdor bsdus pa la bslabs par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa la gnas te mdor bsdus pa la bslabs par bya'o //
translated: Having stood in the ten bodhisattva stages, they should train in the summary.

original: mdor bsdus pa 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas par shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas par shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva great beings who train in this summary will know all dharmas in brief and in detail.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang po rnon pos rtogs pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang po rnon pos rtogs pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Subhuti : This is the realization of the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has keen faculties.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang po zhan pas kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang po zhan pas kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The Lord : This is the realization of the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has weak faculties.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang po 'bring pos kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang po 'bring pos kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is the realization of the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has medium faculties.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang po mnyam par gzhag pas kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang po mnyam par gzhag pas kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: This is the realization of the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has concentrated faculties.

original: 'di ni slob par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis kyang rtogs par mi 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: 'di ni slob par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis kyang rtogs par mi 'gyur ba med do //
translated: There is nothing that the Bodhisattva, the great being, who wants to learn, will not realize.

original: 'di ni le lo can gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ni le lo can gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin /
translated: This is not the realization of the lazy,

original: brtson 'grus zhan pas rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin /
analyzed: brtson 'grus zhan pas rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin /
translated: nor of the weak-willed,

original: dran pa nyams pas rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin /
analyzed: dran pa nyams pas rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin /

original: sems 'khrugs pas rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sems 'khrugs pas rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not realized through a disturbed mind.

original: 'di ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa /
analyzed: 'di ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa /
translated: This is realized through the practice of effort,

original: le lo med pa /
analyzed: le lo med pa /
translated: without laziness,

analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pas rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //

translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: when a bodhisattva great being practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: bdud kyi las ci byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: bdud kyi las ci byung yang rung ste /
translated: whatever deeds of Māra arise

original: de dag thams cad byung ba nyid kyi tshe rab tu spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad byung ba nyid kyi tshe rab tu spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: all of them are abandoned just when they arise.

original: de bas na thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung bar 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung bar 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, a bodhisattva great being who wants to be assisted by skillful means should train in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: cultivates the perfection of wisdom, and strives at the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de la dgongs pa mdzad do //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de la dgongs pa mdzad do // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: then the lord buddhas who live, are present, and teach the Dharma in countless world systems also pay attention to that bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom.🔽Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is because

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag las byung ba ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag las byung ba ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams te /
translated: the lord buddhas of the past, future, and present arise from these six perfections.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la @129a * //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la @129a * //
translated: Therefore, bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: spyod pas 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: spyod pas 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom should investigate as follows:

original: chos gang 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis brnyes par gyur ba dang / brnyes pa dang / brnyes par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag bdag gis kyang thob par bya'o snyam du brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: chos gang 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis brnyes par gyur ba dang / brnyes pa dang / brnyes par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag bdag gis kyang thob par bya'o snyam du brtag par bya ste /
translated: “I should also attain those dharmas that the past, future, and present lord buddhas have attained, are attaining, and will attain.”

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas de ltar brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas de ltar brtson par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom should strive like that.

original: da ltar brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: da ltar brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva great beings who strive like that will quickly and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: rab 'byor de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba dang ma bral bar bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba dang ma bral bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should not be separated from attending to the knowledge of all aspects.🔽If bodhisattva great beings practice like that for the sake of the knowledge of all aspects, then even if it is only for as long as it takes to snap the fingers, the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom of those bodhisattva great beings will bring them much more merit.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du de ltar spyod na chung du na se gol gtogs pa tsam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen🔽po de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel gyi /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du de ltar spyod na chung du na se gol gtogs pa tsam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel gyi /
translated: It is not as much as the merit of those bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can gang ji snyed cig 'khod pa de dag sbyin pas yongs su tshim par byas pa dang / tshul khrims la rab tu bkod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la rab tu bkod pa dang /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can gang ji snyed cig 'khod pa de dag sbyin pas yongs su tshim par byas pa dang / tshul khrims la rab tu bkod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la rab tu bkod pa dang /
translated: The merit of those bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught is much greater than the merit of those who satisfy with gifts and establish in morality, concentration, and wisdom all the sentient beings that there are in the great billionfold world system, and who establish them in the fruits of being a stream enterer, a once-returner, a non-returner, and an arhat, and in individual enlightenment.

original: shes rab la rab tu bkod pa dang / rnam par grol ba la rab tu bkod pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la rab tu bkod pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang /
analyzed: shes rab la rab tu bkod pa dang / rnam par grol ba la rab tu bkod pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la rab tu bkod pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang /
translated: nor in the result of non-returner,🔽nor in the state of a worthy one,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu bkod pa dang / rang byang chub la rab tu bkod pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu bkod pa dang / rang byang chub la rab tu bkod pas ni ma yin te /
translated: nor in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening,

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di se gol gtogs pa tsam du bsgom pa de'i bsod nams ni ches mang du 'phel lo ;
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di se gol gtogs pa tsam du bsgom pa de'i bsod nams ni ches mang du 'phel lo ;
translated: but in this deep perfection of wisdom, which is meditated on for as long as it takes to snap one’s fingers, the merit that increases is much greater.

original: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang /
translated: the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth,🔽the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth,🔽the fruit of arhatship,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras @129b bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub ni 'di las byung ba ste /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras @129b bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub ni 'di las byung ba ste /
translated: and individual enlightenment.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang chos ston pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ngo //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang chos ston pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ngo //
translated: The lord buddhas who are present, alive, and enduring in the world systems of the ten directions, who are teaching the Dharma, have also emerged from this perfection of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las byung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las byung ngo //
translated: Those lord buddhas who have passed into nirvāṇa, who have not yet come, and who are present have also emerged from this very perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang gang skad 'ga'am /🔽nyin 'ga'am / nyi ma brgya'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang gang skad 'ga'am / nyin 'ga'am / nyi ma brgya'am /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, if someone were to practice this perfection of wisdom for a day,🔽or for a few days,🔽or for a hundred days,

original: lo 'ga'am / lo brgya'am /
analyzed: lo 'ga'am / lo brgya'am /
translated: or for a few years,🔽or for a hundred years,

original: bskal pa 'ga'am /
analyzed: bskal pa 'ga'am /
translated: or for a few eons,

original: bskal pa brgya nas bskal pa grangs med pa brgya'i bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs pa'i yid la bya bas bsgom pa de'i bsod nams ni ches mang du 'phel gyi /
analyzed: bskal pa brgya nas bskal pa grangs med pa brgya'i bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs pa'i yid la bya bas bsgom pa de'i bsod nams ni ches mang du 'phel gyi /
translated: or up to a hundred eons, with attention focused on the knowledge of all aspects, their merit would increase much more than that.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sems can gang ji snyed cig 'khod pa de dag thams cad sbyin pa la rab tu bkod pa dang / tshul khrims la rab tu bkod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sems can gang ji snyed cig 'khod pa de dag thams cad sbyin pa la rab tu bkod pa dang / tshul khrims la rab tu bkod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang /
translated: If all the sentient beings in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River were established in generosity, established in discipline, established in concentration, established in wisdom,

original: rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la rab tu bkod pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la rab tu bkod pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang /
translated: and established in the vision of the wisdom of liberation, and established in the fruit of entering the stream, and established in the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, and established in the fruit of no longer being a trainee,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu bkod pa dang / rang byang chub la rab tu bkod pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu bkod pa dang / rang byang chub la rab tu bkod pas ni ma yin no //
translated: and established in individual enlightenment, and established in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: gang gis sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bstan pa dang / tshul khrims dang bsgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bstan pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang /
analyzed: gang gis sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bstan pa dang / tshul khrims dang bsgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bstan pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang /
translated: It is because of the teaching of the meritorious deeds that arise from giving, and the teaching of the meritorious deeds that arise from morality and meditation, and the fruit of entering the stream, and the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub bstan pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang 'di las byung ngo zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyis bstangs pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub bstan pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang 'di las byung ngo zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyis bstangs pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: This is the non-conceptualization of the Buddhas.

original: // / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang de ltar bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa 'di ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya ste /🔽byang @130a * //
analyzed: // / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang de ltar bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa 'di ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya ste / byang @130a * //
translated: The Bodhisattva, the great being, who stands in this perfection of wisdom as it has been taught, should be known as irreversible.

original: chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang thabs mkhas pa 'di dang ldan pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang thabs mkhas pa 'di dang ldan pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The Bodhisattva, the great being, who is endowed with this skill in means, should be known as one who is attended by the Tathagata.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po bsnyen bkur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po bsnyen bkur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The Bodhisattva, the great being, who is endowed with this skill in means, should be known as one who has attended on many niyutas of kotis of Buddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that this bodhisattva mahāsattva has planted the roots of virtue.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that this bodhisattva mahāsattva has been taken up by a spiritual friend.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that this bodhisattva mahāsattva has practiced the six perfections.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni stong pa nyid nyi shu la bsgoms par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni stong pa nyid nyi shu la bsgoms par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that this bodhisattva mahāsattva has meditated on the twenty kinds of emptiness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la bsgoms par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la bsgoms par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that this bodhisattva mahāsattva has meditated on the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: “That bodhisattva great being should be known to have cultivated the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la bsgoms par rig par bya'o /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la bsgoms par rig par bya'o /
translated: the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness gateways to liberation, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la bsgoms par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la bsgoms par rig par bya'o //
translated: “That bodhisattva great being should be known to have cultivated the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, and the four detailed and thorough knowledges.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: “That bodhisattva great being should be known to have the six superknowledges.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzhon nur gyur par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzhon nur gyur par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that this bodhisattva mahāsattva is a youth.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that this bodhisattva mahāsattva has fulfilled his intentions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sangs rgyas mthong ba dang mi 'bral bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sangs rgyas mthong ba dang mi 'bral bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that this bodhisattva mahāsattva is never separated from seeing the buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mi 'bral bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mi 'bral bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that this bodhisattva mahāsattva is never separated from the roots of virtue.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang mi 'bral bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang mi 'bral bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that this bodhisattva mahāsattva is never separated from the buddhafields.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems @130b dpa' chen po de ni spobs pa mi chod pa dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems @130b dpa' chen po de ni spobs pa mi chod pa dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that this bodhisattva mahāsattva has uninterrupted eloquence.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzungs rab tu thob par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzungs rab tu thob par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that this bodhisattva mahāsattva has attained dhāraṇī.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzungs yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzungs yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: “That bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known to have perfected the dhāraṇīs.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni lung bstan pa phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni lung bstan pa phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: “That bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known to have the perfect prophecy.

original: byol song gi skye gnas dang / byol song gi skye gnas kyi lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas dang / byol song gi skye gnas kyi lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that they are skilled in the animal realm and the path to the animal realm.

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that they are skilled in the world of Yama and the path to the world of Yama.

original: mi dang mi'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dang mi'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: mi ma yin pa dang / mi ma yin pa'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that they are skilled in non-humans and the path of non-humans.

original: lha dang lha'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lha dang lha'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that they are skilled in gods and the path of gods.

original: @132b rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: @132b rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “It should be known that they are skilled in the result of stream enterer and the path to the result of stream enterer.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “It should be known that they are skilled in the result of once-returner and the path to the result of once-returner.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “It should be known that they are skilled in the result of non-returner and the path to the result of non-returner.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dang / dgra bcom pa'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dang / dgra bcom pa'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “It should be known that they are skilled in the state of a worthy one and the path to the state of a worthy one.

original: rang byang chub dang / rang byang chub kyi lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rang byang chub dang / rang byang chub kyi lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “It should be known that they are skilled in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening and the path to a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “It should be known that they are skilled in the knowledge of path aspects and the path to the knowledge of path aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “It should be known that they are skilled in the knowledge of all aspects and the path to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: dbang po rnams la mkhas pa dang / dbang po yongs su rdzogs rdzogs par bya ba la mkhas rig par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams la mkhas pa dang / dbang po yongs su rdzogs rdzogs par bya ba la mkhas rig par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as skilled in the faculties, and skilled in perfecting the faculties.

original: shes rab rno ba dang / shes rab mgyogs pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab dang yang dag pa'i shes rab dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i shes rab la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab rno ba dang / shes rab mgyogs pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab dang yang dag pa'i shes rab dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i shes rab la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as skilled in sharp wisdom, quick wisdom, the wisdom of penetration, the wisdom of rightness, and the wisdom of the unequalled.

original: 'das pa'i dus dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as skilled in the past, future, and present.

original: thabs la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as skilled in means.

original: sems can gyi sems dang / bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi sems dang / bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as skilled in the minds, thoughts, and aspirations of sentient beings.

original: don dang yi ge dang theg pa gsum rnam par dgod pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: don dang yi ge dang theg pa gsum rnam par dgod pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as skilled in the meaning, the letters, and the arrangement of the three vehicles.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe phan yon 'di dag yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i lam med pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe phan yon 'di dag yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i lam med pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: Subhūti, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom, these benefits are present. This is the conception of the path of preparation.

original: // / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pas dang zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam med pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: // / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pas dang zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam med pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: By accomplishing the perfection of wisdom, this is the conception of the path of seeing.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom par byed pa de la phan yon 'di dag yod par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam med pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi /🔽ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom par byed pa de la phan yon 'di dag yod par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam med pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi / ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
translated: One should know that these benefits are present for one who cultivates the perfection of wisdom. This is the conception of the path of cultivation.🔽He said, “Blessed One, how should one practice the perfection of wisdom?🔽How should one accomplish the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu @133a * //
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu @133a * //
translated: How should one cultivate the perfection of wisdom?”

original: phyin pa bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: phyin pa bsgom par bgyi /
translated: I will cultivate the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽gzugs bzhi ba dang / gzugs rag pa dang / gzugs rag pa las dang / gzugs gsog dang / gzugs snying po med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / gzugs bzhi ba dang / gzugs rag pa dang / gzugs rag pa las dang / gzugs gsog dang / gzugs snying po med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽“One should practice the perfection of wisdom because form is fourfold, form is dependent, form is empty, and form is essenceless.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam pa shes pa bzhi ba dang / rnam par shes pa rag las pa dang / rnam par shes pa gsog dang / rnam par shes pa snying po med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam pa shes pa bzhi ba dang / rnam par shes pa rag las pa dang / rnam par shes pa gsog dang / rnam par shes pa snying po med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod par bya'o //
translated: One should practice the perfection of wisdom because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are fourfold, consciousness is dependent, consciousness is empty, and consciousness is essenceless.”

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhi ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rag las pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gsog dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba snying po med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i lam mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhi ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rag las pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gsog dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba snying po med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i lam mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: This is the conception of ignorance about the path of preparation.

original: // / gang yang 'di skad du ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par bsgrub par bya zhes zer ba ni nam mkha' stong pa nyid mngon par bsgrub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba
analyzed: // / gang yang 'di skad du ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par bsgrub par bya zhes zer ba ni nam mkha' stong pa nyid mngon par bsgrub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba
translated: When someone asks, “How should one practice the perfection of wisdom?” one should reply, “The perfection of wisdom should be practiced by accomplishing the emptiness of space.”

original: ni mthong ba'i lam mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: ni mthong ba'i lam mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: This is the conception of ignorance about the path of seeing.

original: gang yang 'di skad du ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya zhes zer ba ni nam mkha' stong pa nyid du bsgom pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam mi
analyzed: gang yang 'di skad du ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya zhes zer ba ni nam mkha' stong pa nyid du bsgom pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam mi
translated: And if someone were to ask, How should one cultivate the perfection of wisdom? one should say, By cultivating the emptiness of space, one should cultivate the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
translated: This is the path of cultivation.

original: 'di dag gis ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po rnam pa dgu gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po rnam pa dgu gsungs pa yin no /
translated: These are the first nine types of conceptual thoughts about the apprehended.

original: // / rab 'byor gyis gsol pa ;
analyzed: // / rab 'byor gyis gsol pa ;
translated: Subhūti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yun ring po ji srid cig tu spyad na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yun ring po ji srid cig tu spyad na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par 'gyur /
translated: Bhagavan, for how long should bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom in order to practice the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung nas zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems mi bskyed ba'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: From the first production of the thought of enlightenment is a conceptualization that does not produce the thought of enlightenment.

original: // / snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: // / snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: One should practice the perfection of wisdom until one sits on the seat of enlightenment.

original: de ltar mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should accomplish it in that way.

original: de ltar bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi snying po yid la mi byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: de ltar bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi snying po yid la mi byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: One should cultivate it in that way is a conceptualization that does not attend to the seat of enlightenment.

original: // / @133b gsol pa /
analyzed: // / @133b gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar sems gzhan gyi go skabs mi 'byed par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar sems gzhan gyi go skabs mi 'byed par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi'am /
translated: Blessed One, how should one practice the perfection of wisdom without giving an opportunity to other thoughts?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: yid la bya ba gzhan gyi go skabs mi 'byed pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la bya ba gzhan gyi go skabs mi 'byed pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: One should practice the perfection of wisdom without giving an opportunity to other mental activities.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa yid la bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa yid la bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa yin no /
translated: To think, “I will cultivate the perfection of wisdom” is a conceptualization of the kind of attention that is the vehicle of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: // / rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba mi 'dor bas ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams mi 'jug pa de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: // / rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba mi 'dor bas ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams mi 'jug pa de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya /
translated: Subhūti, without abandoning attention to the knowledge of all aspects, you should practice the perfection of wisdom in such a way that mental factors and mental episodes do not occur.🔽You should practice the perfection of wisdom.🔽You should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: You should cultivate the perfection of wisdom.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci lags shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi phyin pa la mngon par bsgrub pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram /

translated: He asked, “Blessed One, is it the case that one who practices the perfection of wisdom, who actualizes the perfection of wisdom, and who cultivates the perfection of wisdom will attain the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
